sections.text: Liability for debts; usufruct establishedmortis causaWhen the usufruct is establishedmortis causa, the usufructuary is not liable for estate debts, but the property subject to the usufruct may be sold for the payment of estate debts, in accordance with the rules provided for the payment of the debt of an estate in Book III of this Code.Acts 1976, No. 103, ยง1; Acts 2010, No. 881, ยง1, eff.
